response.title: Classic Chocolate Birthday Cake
directions: Preheat the oven to 350°F (177°C). Grease two 9-inch cake rounds. Dust with flour and tap out the excess.
Mix the flour, cocoa powder, sugar, baking powder, baking soda, and salt together in a large bowl.
In another bowl, mix the eggs, milk, oil, and vanilla. Pour into the dry ingredients and beat until fully combined.
Pour in the boiling water and mix until the batter is smooth. It will be thin but that is okay.
Divide the batter between the two pans and bake for 25-30 minutes.
Let the cakes cool in the pans for 10 minutes then remove from pans and transfer to wire racks. Cool completely before frosting.

instructions: With a handheld or stand mixer fitted with a whisk attachment, beat the heavy cream until stiff peaks form.
In a separate bowl, beat the butter until creamy. Add powdered sugar, cocoa powder, and vanilla extract, and beat until fluffy.
Gently fold in the whipped cream until the frosting is smooth and spreadable.
